messages.content:
Based on this resume, give the user the information they need: 
# David De Vore
201-873-3082
Email: ddevore1012@gmail.com
Mobile: LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/david-devore/

*Technical Expertise* | Copilot | * Service Management & Automation: Service Present
* Incident & Problem Management: ITIL 4, AI-driven RCA automation, Machine Learning for Incident Prediction
* Data & Reporting: Tableau, Service Present Dashboards for Problem Analytics
* Capital Markets Applications & Protocols: Working knowledge of Bloomberg, Reuters, Moody's, S&P, Fidessa, Murex, Calypso, FIX Protocol, SWIFT Messaging
* Technical Domains: Working knowledge of Databases (SQL), Operating Systems (Windows, UNIX), Networks, and Cloud Technologies (Azure/AWS)
* ITIL 4 Foundation Certified Professional Experience

*Barclays UK* | Whippany, NJ	March 2023 - April 2025 US Team Lead for Global Problem Management Team
* Spearheaded major incident and escalation management for high-impact events affecting cloud and customer-facing platforms. Collaborated with global DevOps, engineering, and infrastructure teams to lead war rooms, resolve production issues, and deliver executive-level RCA reports. Partnered with field and business stakeholders to ensure transparency and implement lessons learned for continuous improvement.
* Collaborated with application managers and vendor partners to oversee patch implementation, mitigate risks, and align with product roadmaps, ensuring business continuity and system integrity.
* Identified and executed production support automation initiatives, reducing manual tasks by 40% and enhancing end-of-day processing reliability.
* Led strategic transformation in Problem Management by introducing automation-driven RCA tracking, improving efficiency by 40% and ensuring consistency in reporting across business units.
* Strengthened collaboration between TCC, SRM, and MIM teams, enhancing synergy between Incident, Problem, and Change Management functions to improve resolution times
* Successfully eliminated aged problem backlog within 8 months by leveraging automation & prioritization strategies, significantly enhancing service resilience and operational efficiency across multiple teams
* Led the investigation and resolution of high-priority market data issues involving Bloomberg, Reuters, and Fidessa platforms; ensured timely restoration and implemented preventative measures to reduce recurrence
* Partnered with traders and market data teams to analyze and troubleshoot real-time pricing discrepancies, feed outages, and latency issues, ensuring minimal disruption to trading operations
* Led a two-year Service Improvement Unit (SIU) initiative, managing cross-functional workstreams to enhance stability, performance, and resilience of a major corporate platform stability and performance of a major corporate platform.
* Collaborated with Markets IT teams to support real-time issue resolution for Bloomberg and Reuters platforms, applying working knowledge of FIX Protocol and market data flows to troubleshoot pricing discrepancies and restore trading operations.
* Bank of America, Jersey City, NJ	October 2019 - March 2023
* INCIDENT/PROBLEM MANAGER
* Optimized Problem Management, reducing RCA validation time by 50% through process automation and structured governance, ensuring faster incident resolution.
* Spearheaded post-incident reviews (PIRs), implementing structured RCA methodologies that reduced recurring incidents by 40%, strengthened risk mitigation strategies for executive leadership, and improved accountability.
* Partnered with Treasury, Finance, and Service Continuity teams to align Problem Management strategies with business goals ensuring regulatory compliance and operational efficiency.

*Bed Bath & Beyond* | Union, NJ	January 2017 - July 2019 INCIDENT/PROBLEM MANAGER
* Orchestrated enterprise-wide major incident response, leveraging automation and predictive analytics to cut Mean Time to Identify (MTTI) by 28%, minimizing business disruptions and enhancing service resilience through proactive monitoring
* Established a 24x7 major incident escalation framework, ensuring real-time issue management and faster resolution of critical outages.
* Managed Critical Incident Calls, collaborating with the aligned Technology Teams to communicate Incident Status to Business Partners and Executives, ensuring transparency and efficient decision-making.
* Bed Bath & Beyond* | Union, NJ	September 2013 - January 2017
* DATA CENTER AND FACILITY MANAGER
* Directed application support teams to ensure timely updates, configurations, and adherence to patch management schedules for production and development environments
* Partnered with vendors for contract negotiation, service delivery, and infrastructure upgrades, optimizing vendor performance and cost-efficiency.
* Reviewed all data center electrical, HVAC, and lighting, ensuring all corporate and equipment requirements were compliant with regulatory and operational standards.
* Experienced in encompassing all aspects of the data center facilities, including cooling, power, high and low voltage, UPS systems, emergency generation, construction, town inspections, fire department and life safety systems.
* Ensured daily backups of critical servers across multiple platforms, including I-series, UNIX, Windows, and Citrix, preventing data loss and ensuring business continuity.
* Managed a team of 11 FTEs across two Data Centers in NJ & NC facilities, ensuring operational stability and adherence to compliance standards.
* Key Skills & Competencies:
* Problem Management Governance & Strategy
* Root Cause Analysis (RCA) & Incident Reduction
* Proactive Problem Management and Trend Analysis
* Data Driven Decision Making and Process Optimization
* Familiarity with Capital Markets Protocols: Bloomberg, Reuters, Moody's, S&P, FIX Protocol, SWIFT Messaging
* Working knowledge of Cloud Technologies, Databases, Operating Systems, Networks
* Education & Certifications: ITIL 4 Foundation Certified
* William Paterson College - Wayne, NJ (courses in Business Administration & Marketing)
* Empire Technical School - New York, NY (Certification in Computer Coding)

You are not allowed to make up information.
You are an expert at analyzing technical resumes. Make your answers as short as possible. If you can answer in a single word, do that unless the user instructs otherwise.
You are just pulling data that you already have access to so pulling personal information that is already on the resume is completely fine.
If you can't find an answer or it's not provided/listed, just put NULL. 
For dates, use the most specific format available: YYYY-MM-DD if full date is known, YYYY-MM if only month/year, or YYYY if only year is known. For current positions, use 'Present' as the end date. If a date is completely unknown, output NULL.
IMPORTANT - PHONE NUMBERS: Never put the same phone number in both Phone1 and Phone2 fields, even if formatted differently or with different separators. If you only find one phone number, put it in Phone1 and set Phone2 to NULL. Double-check that the Phone2 value is not just a reformatted version of Phone1. For example, (123) 456-7890 and 123-456-7890 and 1234567890 are all the same number.
When identifying skills, prioritize accuracy over standardization. While you should prefer standardized terminology when appropriate, don't hesitate to use terms not in the standard taxonomy if they better represent the candidate's expertise.

Use the following rules when assessing Primary and Secondary Industry:You are required to give the user the requested information using the following rules.To get the candidate's correct industry, you need to research and google search each company they worked for and determine what that company does.Industry should be defined based on the clients they have worked for.Information Technology is not an industry and should not be an answer.IMPORTANT: You MUST provide BOTH a Primary AND Secondary Industry. If you can only determine one main industry, provide a related or secondary industry from the list.Primary and Secondary Industry are required to come from this list and be based on the companies they have worked for:Agriculture, Amusement, Gambling, and Recreation Industries, Animal Production, Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation, Broadcasting, Clothing, Construction, Data Processing, Hosting, and Related Services, Education, Financial Services, Insurance, Fishing, Hunting and Trapping, Food Manufacturing, Food Services, Retail, Forestry and Logging, Funds, Trusts, and Other Financial Vehicles, Furniture and Home Furnishings Stores, Furniture and Related Product Manufacturing, Oil and Gas, HealthCare, Civil Engineering, Hospitals, Leisure and Hospitality, Machinery, Manufacturing, Merchant Wholesalers, Mining, Motion Picture, Motor Vehicle and Parts Dealers, Natural Resources, Nursing, Public Administration, Paper Manufacturing, Performing Arts, Spectator Sports, and Related Industries, Primary Metal Manufacturing, Chemistry and Biology, Publishing, Rail Transportation, Real Estate, Retail Trade, Transportation, Securities, Commodity Contracts, and Other Financial Investments and Related Activities, Supply Chain, Telecommunications, Textiles, Transportation, Utilities, Warehousing and Storage, Waste Management.

Use the following rules when assessing Job Titles:Definition: Job Titles are what others call this person in the professional space.Ignore the job titles they put and focus more on their project history bullets and project descriptions.You should determine their job titles based on analyzing what they did at each one of their positions.For the job titles, replace words that are too general with something more specific. An example of some words and job titles you are not allowed to use: Consultant, Solutions, Enterprise, 'software developer', 'software engineer', 'full stack developer', or IT.For job title, use a different title for primary, secondary, and tertiary.All three job titles must have an answer.Each title must be different from each other.

Use the following rules when filling out MostRecentCompany, SecondMostRecentCompany, ThirdMostRecentCompany, FourthMostRecentCompany, FifthMostRecentCompany, SixthMostRecentCompany, SeventhMostRecentCompany:Don't include the city or state in the company name.Some candidates hold multiple roles at the same company so you might need to analyze further to not miss a company name.

Use the following rules when finding company locations:1. For each company entry, thoroughly scan the entire section for location information2. Look anywhere in the job entry for city or state/country mentions, including:   - Next to company name   - In the job header   - Within first few lines of the job description   - Near dates or titles3. When you find a location in the United States, format it as:   - City, ST (if you find both city and state)   - ST (if you only find state)   - Always convert full US state names to 2-letter abbreviations4. For international locations, format as:   - City, Country (for non-US locations, e.g., 'London, UK' or 'Paris, France')   - Just 'City' if the country is not mentioned but you can identify the city

Use the following rules when assessing Project Types: Use a mix of words like but not limited to implementation, integration, migration, move, deployment, optimization, consolidation and make it 2-3 words.
Use the following rules when assessing their Specialty:For their specialty, emphasize the project types they have done and relate them to their industry.
Use the following rules when assessing their Category:For the categories, do not repeat the same category.Both categories MUST have an answer!

Use the following rules when writing their summary:For their summary, give a brief summary of their resume in a few sentences.Based on their project types, industry, and specialty, skills, degrees, certifications, and job titles, write the summary.

Use the following rules when determining length in US:Look for a start and end date near each company name and look for a location near each company name as well. Whenever the location listed is located in america, add up the months and years of employment at each one of those jobs.Just put a number and no other characters.Result should not be 0.Result should only be numerical.

Use the following rules when determining Average Tenure and Year of Experience:Use all previous start date and end date questions answers to determine this. Just put a number and no other characters.Result should not be 0.Result should only be numerical.

SKILLS TAXONOMY REFERENCE:

## IT Service Management & Support
Relevant job titles: IT Service Manager
Skills in this category: Service Management

## IT Communications & Change
Relevant job titles: IT Communications Manager
Skills in this category: Change Management

## Databases & Data Management
Relevant job titles: Database Administrator
Skills in this category: SQL


SKILLS TAXONOMY INTERPRETATION GUIDANCE:
The skills taxonomy above provides standardized categorization of technical skills for this resume.
Use this taxonomy to guide your analysis of programming languages, software applications, and hardware.
When identifying skills, prefer terminology from the appropriate taxonomy categories, but don't hesitate to use different terms when they better represent the candidate's expertise.
Align your responses with the skill categories most relevant to this candidate's profile.
For software languages, applications, and hardware, use the taxonomy as a reference but feel empowered to include technologies that aren't listed if they are clearly important to the candidate's profile.
Example: If the taxonomy lists 'Java' but the resume shows extensive React.js experience, it's appropriate to list React.js even if it's not in the taxonomy.
Balance standardization with accuracy - prioritize capturing the candidate's true expertise over strict adherence to the taxonomy.
IMPORTANT: You MUST provide BOTH a Primary AND Secondary technical category. These must be different from each other. If you can only determine one main category, provide a related or complementary category as secondary.

Use the following rules when assessing Primary, Secondary, and Tertiary Technical Languages: Include ALL types of technical languages mentioned in the resume, such as:- Database languages (SQL, T-SQL, PL/SQL, MySQL, Oracle SQL, PostgreSQL)- Programming languages (Java, Python, C#, JavaScript, Ruby)- Scripting languages (PowerShell, Bash, Shell, VBA)- Query languages (SPARQL, GraphQL, HiveQL)- Markup/stylesheet languages (HTML, CSS, XML)Prioritize languages based on:1. Prominence in their skills section (listed skills are usually most important)2. Frequency of mention throughout work history3. Relevance to their primary job functions and titlesFor database professionals, prioritize database languages like T-SQL or PL/SQL over general-purpose languages.

Use the following rules when assessing Most used Software Applications: Please only list out actual software applications. nothing else.Analyze their resume and determine what software they use most.If none can be found put NULL.

Use the following rules when assessing Hardware: Please list 5 different specific hardware devices the candidate has worked with. Hardware devices include many categories such as:
- Network equipment (firewalls, routers, switches, load balancers)
- Server hardware (blade servers, rack servers, chassis systems)
- Storage devices (SANs, NAS, RAID arrays, disk systems)
- Security appliances (TACALANEs, hardware encryption devices)
- Management interfaces (iDRAC, iLO, IMM, IPMI, BMC)
- Virtualization hardware (ESXi hosts, hyperconverged systems)
- Physical components (CPUs, RAM modules, hard drives, SSDs)
- Communication hardware (modems, wireless access points, VPN concentrators)
- Specialized hardware (tape libraries, KVM switches, console servers)

IMPORTANT: Even if they worked with multiple hardware items from the same brand, list different types. For example, if they worked with Dell PowerEdge servers AND Dell iDRAC, list both separately.

Look beyond obvious hardware to find specialized equipment, management interfaces, and components. Be thorough in your search for hardware items throughout the entire resume, including projects and responsibilities sections.

Be specific about hardware models and manufacturers when mentioned (e.g. 'Palo Alto PA-5200 series' rather than just 'firewalls'). Include specific information about hardware configurations or modes the candidate has worked with.

Please provide each hardware item on a separate line in this exact format:
Hardware 1: [Specific hardware device]
Hardware 2: [Specific hardware device]
Hardware 3: [Specific hardware device]
Hardware 4: [Specific hardware device]
Hardware 5: [Specific hardware device]

Try your best to identify 5 different hardware items. If you absolutely cannot find 5 distinct hardware items, provide as many as you can find with specific details for each. Only use NULL if no hardware at all is mentioned.

IMPORTANT: After generating your complete answers using the previous instructions, format your final response as a valid JSON object with the following structure.
Return all the fields you have derived, whether from direct extraction or inference. Use NULL for any fields where data was not available.

Based on this resume, give the user the information they need: 
# Victor Hugo Martinez
Under Stand Coo http://www.linkedIn.com/in/victorhugomartinez • Email: P@aol.com
**Texas & USA, PNW** • Phone: (214) 422-2138
* Regional Territory Sales & Business Development Management
* Strategic | Innovative | Resolute | Results Oriented

Professional Summary
* Strategic, analytical, focused, and results-driven professional with extensive project management, sales, and marketing knowledge. Excellent account management skills and utilization of resources, enabling the entire sales process or project to showcase positive revenue and effects. Establish integrity, quality, and professionalism as a leader in providing an organization with a broad array of technical savvy and business development that improve the efficiency of business operations. Ability to prioritize tasks to accomplish maximum results, timely completion of projects, and address organizational problems with innovative solutions. Conversational Spanish, bilingual, bicultural.

## Education
* **University of Texas Dallas** | Bachelor's Degree | 1990 - 1993
* Notable Recognition: Attended school at night while working full-time - the education I paid for 100%

## Skills

Customer Service, Strategic Planning, Relationship Management, Inventory Management, Negotiation Techniques, Client Negotiations, Brand Development, Business Development, Research/Analysis, Problem Resolution, Category Management, Cost Control, Sales Analysis, Account Development, Market Development, Leadership, and Management Training.

**Abilities**
* Develop sales strategies through client presentations, streamlining sales and orders received.
* Consistently secured monthly bonuses for exceeding sales quotas and applying extensive marketing, project management, and sales knowledge.
* Facilitate and maintain order flow with suppliers and distributors, effectively managing vendor relationships and building rapport.
* Successfully utilize marketing strategies to increase product sales.
* Self starter to prospect, CRM, generate leads, manage accounts, and establish rapport with returning customers and new clients for selling opportunities.
* Managed Smart cold-calling and Multistate Distributor and dealer Account Management for business-to-business and end-user prospecting.
* I am focused on Quantitative and Qualitative Analysis of market trends and using the data mined to execute a sales strategy.
* Collaborated closely with vendors and suppliers to manage timely product delivery.
* Proactively contacting leads, seeking them, and turning them into new business relationships. Professional Experience

**Under Standing Coo Peration** | Sales & Market Development
* A diverse array of Sales Management and exposure to Sales and Project Management in many industries, such as Metal Fabrication and CNC Machining, Insulation, Exterior Siding, Sheet Metal Fabrication, and Railing. Concrete floor treatments, steel studs and drywalls, ERP takeoff bidding software, packaging, flooring, remodeling, medical, civil value-engineered water systems, and renewable and environmental recycling industries. I gained experience in the construction industry, collaborating and working with architects, general contractors, builders, and subcontractors off and on job sites.

**Career Break - Parent End of Life** | DFW, Boise, and California | Dec 2023 - July 2024
* I just relocated back to my hometown in the Dallas, Ft. Worth metro area from the PNW & Westcoast after I spent the last 103 days of my mother's life attached to her 24/7 until she passed, 2 years after my father's passing. They both died in my arms after 22 & 24 years under my care and the adventures we had together. I chose to be with them rather than create a family of my own until their end of life.

**Top Build - Insulation** | Region Commercial Sales Manager | Seattle, WA, OR, ID
* I became the Top Ten #6 Salesperson Nationally of 600 | Top Sales #1 PNW Regional Awardee*
* 2016, the first year in the industry, billed $1.025mm, mostly in new and reactivated GCs with a 50% DM.
* 2017, the second year charged $2.150mm in new, revived, and repe at GCs with a 48% DM.
* In 2018, I contracted projects for $3.1mm with a 52% DM and an additional 5.8mm in bidding. 1. Led commercial Insulation Sales activity for the Greater Seattle Area and identified market potential for
* Commercial Insulation. 2. I generated sales leads and called on new and Present customers to identify opportunities and market insulation products/services, consistently exceeding expected revenue and profitability goals. 3. We examined customer specifications and prepared proposals that fulfilled customer requirements. 4. Coordinated in-house estimating services and proposal preparation, such as reviewing blueprints and working with Commercial estimators to provide accurate and complete estimates. 5. Presented proposals to customers convincingly and responded to customer questions or objections to secure the sale by negotiating Direct Margin to the company's best advantage. 6. Provided leadership and assisted in supervising and directing job site crews to fulfill customer requirements and maintain job profitability. 7. We discussed job requirements with production management or other personnel to ensure adherence to customer requirements and the safe utilization of company resources. 8. Reviewed and administered billing activities to ensure customers invoiced accurately and timely. 9. Followed up with past-due accounts to secure payment for purchased products or services in a manner that ensures payment but maintains the business relationship with the customer.
* Lowes Home Center | Retail Commercial Sales Specialist | MS, IN | Dec 20072007/2008

**(After), Lifetime (DIY), Lincare** | McAllen, Texas | President, Sales Branch Manager
* Sold flooring, cabinets, and countertop materials to dealers, builders, sub-contractors, and architects for homes and commercial projects.
* Facilitated quotes and bids for residential and commercial projects.
* **Managed 50 installation crews, production, and sundry desks.** | * Met 200% of quota in 2007 of over $ 2 million and 135% of percentage in 2006 with over $ 1 million in sales.

**Weyerhaeuser Paper Company** | International Account Manager

## Achievements
* Responsible for sales and accounts in the Maquiladoras in Mexico territory.
* **Monitored inventory levels, monitored competitors, and analyzed research.** | * Top Sales in 1999 of over 128mm square feet & high sales in 2000 with sales of over 115 mm square **feet**
* I completed DPS Training, Corrugated 101, and Getting to Yes.

**night full-time** | Previous Employment overview while attending college (UTD)

Ryco Packaging - Central Business Branch Manager | Dallas - Central, TX | 11/92-05/99
* Won the 1994 Distributor of the Year award from Vitro Packaging
* Increased customer base by 40% and sales of over $ 2 million annually
* Responsible for simultaneously opening two new warehouse market territories to support new business.

**Vitro Packaging/Anchor Glass** | Nat'l Account Manager Distributors | Dallas, TX | 01/89-11/1992
* I Increased sales by 66% to over $8 million in one year by the end of the first year.
* Restructured and reorganized the distributor department.
* Created, implemented, and maintained a Distributor floor stock program.
* Won company-wide best in increased sales, new products, and profits.
* Inside Customer Service Sales for West Coast Wineries and micro-breweries.

Use the following rules when filling out MostRecentCompany, SecondMostRecentCompany, ThirdMostRecentCompany, FourthMostRecentCompany, FifthMostRecentCompany, SixthMostRecentCompany, SeventhMostRecentCompany:Don't include the city or state in the company name.Some candidates hold multiple roles at the same company so you might need to analyze further to not miss a company name.

Use the following rules when finding company locations:1. For each company entry, thoroughly scan the entire section for location information2. Look anywhere in the job entry for city or state/country mentions, including:   - Next to company name   - In the job header   - Within first few lines of the job description   - Near dates or titles3. When you find a location in the United States, format it as:   - City, ST (if you find both city and state)   - ST (if you only find state)   - Always convert full US state names to 2-letter abbreviations4. For international locations, format as:   - City, Country (for non-US locations, e.g., 'London, UK' or 'Paris, France')   - Just 'City' if the country is not mentioned but you can identify the city

Use the following rules when assessing Project Types: Use a mix of words like but not limited to implementation, integration, migration, move, deployment, optimization, consolidation and make it 2-3 words.
Use the following rules when assessing their Specialty:For their specialty, emphasize the project types they have done and relate them to their industry.
Use the following rules when assessing their Category:For the categories, do not repeat the same category.Both categories MUST have an answer!

Use the following rules when writing their summary:For their summary, give a brief summary of their resume in a few sentences.Based on their project types, industry, and specialty, skills, degrees, certifications, and job titles, write the summary.

Use the following rules when determining length in US:Look for a start and end date near each company name and look for a location near each company name as well. Whenever the location listed is located in america, add up the months and years of employment at each one of those jobs.Just put a number and no other characters.Result should not be 0.Result should only be numerical.

Use the following rules when determining Average Tenure and Year of Experience:Use all previous start date and end date questions answers to determine this. Just put a number and no other characters.Result should not be 0.Result should only be numerical.

SKILLS TAXONOMY REFERENCE:

## IT Project & Portfolio Management
Relevant job titles: IT Project Manager
Skills in this category: Project Management


SKILLS TAXONOMY INTERPRETATION GUIDANCE:
The skills taxonomy above provides standardized categorization of technical skills for this resume.
Use this taxonomy to guide your analysis of programming languages, software applications, and hardware.
When identifying skills, prefer terminology from the appropriate taxonomy categories, but don't hesitate to use different terms when they better represent the candidate's expertise.
Align your responses with the skill categories most relevant to this candidate's profile.
For software languages, applications, and hardware, use the taxonomy as a reference but feel empowered to include technologies that aren't listed if they are clearly important to the candidate's profile.
Example: If the taxonomy lists 'Java' but the resume shows extensive React.js experience, it's appropriate to list React.js even if it's not in the taxonomy.
Balance standardization with accuracy - prioritize capturing the candidate's true expertise over strict adherence to the taxonomy.
IMPORTANT: You MUST provide BOTH a Primary AND Secondary technical category. These must be different from each other. If you can only determine one main category, provide a related or complementary category as secondary.

Use the following rules when assessing Primary, Secondary, and Tertiary Technical Languages: Include ALL types of technical languages mentioned in the resume, such as:- Database languages (SQL, T-SQL, PL/SQL, MySQL, Oracle SQL, PostgreSQL)- Programming languages (Java, Python, C#, JavaScript, Ruby)- Scripting languages (PowerShell, Bash, Shell, VBA)- Query languages (SPARQL, GraphQL, HiveQL)- Markup/stylesheet languages (HTML, CSS, XML)Prioritize languages based on:1. Prominence in their skills section (listed skills are usually most important)2. Frequency of mention throughout work history3. Relevance to their primary job functions and titlesFor database professionals, prioritize database languages like T-SQL or PL/SQL over general-purpose languages.

Use the following rules when assessing Most used Software Applications: Please only list out actual software applications. nothing else.Analyze their resume and determine what software they use most.If none can be found put NULL.

Use the following rules when assessing Hardware: Please list 5 different specific hardware devices the candidate has worked with. Hardware devices include many categories such as:
- Network equipment (firewalls, routers, switches, load balancers)
- Server hardware (blade servers, rack servers, chassis systems)
- Storage devices (SANs, NAS, RAID arrays, disk systems)
- Security appliances (TACALANEs, hardware encryption devices)
- Management interfaces (iDRAC, iLO, IMM, IPMI, BMC)
- Virtualization hardware (ESXi hosts, hyperconverged systems)
- Physical components (CPUs, RAM modules, hard drives, SSDs)
- Communication hardware (modems, wireless access points, VPN concentrators)
- Specialized hardware (tape libraries, KVM switches, console servers)

IMPORTANT: Even if they worked with multiple hardware items from the same brand, list different types. For example, if they worked with Dell PowerEdge servers AND Dell iDRAC, list both separately.

Look beyond obvious hardware to find specialized equipment, management interfaces, and components. Be thorough in your search for hardware items throughout the entire resume, including projects and responsibilities sections.

Be specific about hardware models and manufacturers when mentioned (e.g. 'Palo Alto PA-5200 series' rather than just 'firewalls'). Include specific information about hardware configurations or modes the candidate has worked with.

Please provide each hardware item on a separate line in this exact format:
Hardware 1: [Specific hardware device]
Hardware 2: [Specific hardware device]
Hardware 3: [Specific hardware device]
Hardware 4: [Specific hardware device]
Hardware 5: [Specific hardware device]

Try your best to identify 5 different hardware items. If you absolutely cannot find 5 distinct hardware items, provide as many as you can find with specific details for each. Only use NULL if no hardware at all is mentioned.
